title: Fix Internet Identity login failing on desktop/laptop

requirements.text: Reproduce and fix the Internet Identity authentication flow so that users can successfully log in when accessing the app from a laptop/desktop browser.

quotes: Ok when i try to access it from laptop login authentication does not work

acceptanceCriteria: From a desktop/laptop browser (at minimum: Chrome and Safari, or Chrome and Firefox), clicking the header Login button completes the Internet Identity flow and results in a non-anonymous identity in the app.
After successful login on desktop/laptop, authenticated-only UI (e.g., ability to create reviews / access Reading Tracker features) works without requiring a hard refresh.
If login fails, the UI surfaces a clear error state/message (in English) instead of silently failing, and the failure is logged to the console with enough detail to debug (e.g., error name/message).

requirements.text: Harden the Internet Identity configuration so it is valid in production across devices by ensuring the identityProvider and derivationOrigin configuration used by `AuthClient.login()` are always set to correct, production-safe values (including a safe fallback when environment values are missing).

quotes: Ok when i try to access it from laptop login authentication does not work

acceptanceCriteria: `AuthClient.login()` is invoked with a non-empty `identityProvider` value in production builds (no undefined/empty provider).
If a derivation origin is required for the deployed origin, it is correctly configured so desktop/laptop login succeeds (no origin/derivation mismatch errors).
The app continues to work when opened via different origins users may use (e.g., direct canister URL vs a custom/served domain), without breaking login.

requirements.text: Improve the desktop/laptop login UX resilience by detecting and handling common desktop failure modes (e.g., popup blocked / interrupted login / stale already-authenticated client state) and providing a reliable recovery path using the existing Login button.

quotes: Ok when i try to access it from laptop login authentication does not work

acceptanceCriteria: If the browser blocks the Internet Identity popup/redirect, the user sees an actionable message in the UI (in English) indicating they may need to allow popups and try again.

If the app detects a stale authenticated state (e.g., 'User is already authenticated' but identity is not usable), clicking Login results in a successful authenticated session without requiring manual local storage clearing.
Logout followed by Login works reliably on desktop/laptop without requiring a page reload.

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts` or `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts` if they are in the immutable paths list (compose via wrappers or configuration changes elsewhere if needed).
Keep all backend logic in the single Motoko actor (`backend/main.mo`); only add a `backend/migration.mo` if a state upgrade is truly required for this fix.
nonGoals: Adding new authentication providers (only Internet Identity is in scope).
Implementing new product features unrelated to fixing desktop/laptop login (e.g., new pages, new review functionality).
Backend data model changes, unless proven necessary to resolve the login issue.
